trans-unit.source: Listing your application in the Azure Active Directory application gallery
trans-unit.target: Listing your application in the Azure Active Directory application gallery

trans-unit.source: How to list an application that supports single sign-on in the Azure Active Directory gallery | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: How to list an application that supports single sign-on in the Azure Active Directory gallery | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Listing your application in the Azure Active Directory application gallery
trans-unit.target: Listing your application in the Azure Active Directory application gallery

trans-unit.source: To list an application that supports single sign-on with Azure Active Directory in the [Azure AD gallery](http://azure.microsoft.com/marketplace/active-directory/all/), the application first needs to implement one of the following integration modes:
trans-unit.target: To list an application that supports single sign-on with Azure Active Directory in the [Azure AD gallery](http://azure.microsoft.com/marketplace/active-directory/all/), the application first needs to implement one of the following integration modes:

trans-unit.source: **OpenID Connect** - Direct integration with Azure AD using OpenID Connect for authentication and the Azure AD consent API for configuration.
trans-unit.target: **OpenID Connect** - Direct integration with Azure AD using OpenID Connect for authentication and the Azure AD consent API for configuration.

trans-unit.source: If you are just starting an integration and your application does not support SAML, then this is the recommend mode.
trans-unit.target: If you are just starting an integration and your application does not support SAML, then this is the recommend mode.

trans-unit.source: **SAML** – Your application already has the ability to configure third-party identity providers using the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: **SAML** – Your application already has the ability to configure third-party identity providers using the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: Listing requirements for each mode are below.
trans-unit.target: Listing requirements for each mode are below.

trans-unit.source: OpenID Connect Integration
trans-unit.target: OpenID Connect Integration

trans-unit.source: To integrate your application with Azure AD, following the [developer instructions](active-directory-authentication-scenarios.md).
trans-unit.target: To integrate your application with Azure AD, following the [developer instructions](active-directory-authentication-scenarios.md).

trans-unit.source: Then complete the questions below and send to waadpartners@microsoft.com.
trans-unit.target: Then complete the questions below and send to waadpartners@microsoft.com.

trans-unit.source: Provide credentials for a test tenant or account with your application that can be used by the Azure AD team to test the integration.
trans-unit.target: Provide credentials for a test tenant or account with your application that can be used by the Azure AD team to test the integration.

trans-unit.source: Provide instructions on how the Azure AD team can sign in and connect an instance of Azure AD to your application using the [Azure AD consent framework](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/active-directory-integrating-applications/#overview-of-the-consent-framework).
trans-unit.target: Provide instructions on how the Azure AD team can sign in and connect an instance of Azure AD to your application using the [Azure AD consent framework](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/active-directory-integrating-applications/#overview-of-the-consent-framework).

trans-unit.source: Provide any further instructions required for the Azure AD team to test single sign-on with your application.
trans-unit.target: Provide any further instructions required for the Azure AD team to test single sign-on with your application.

trans-unit.source: Provide the info below:
trans-unit.target: Provide the info below:

trans-unit.source: Company Name:
trans-unit.target: Company Name:

trans-unit.source: Company Website:
trans-unit.target: Company Website:

trans-unit.source: Application Name:
trans-unit.target: Application Name:

trans-unit.source: Application Description (256 character limit):
trans-unit.target: Application Description (256 character limit):

trans-unit.source: Application Website (informational):
trans-unit.target: Application Website (informational):

trans-unit.source: Application Technical Support Website or Contact Info:
trans-unit.target: Application Technical Support Website or Contact Info:

trans-unit.source: Client ID of the application, as shown in the application details at https://manage.windowsazure.com:
trans-unit.target: Client ID of the application, as shown in the application details at https://manage.windowsazure.com:

trans-unit.source: Application Sign-Up URL where customers go to sign up for and /or purchase the application:
trans-unit.target: Application Sign-Up URL where customers go to sign up for and /or purchase the application:

trans-unit.source: Choose up to three categories for your application to be listed under (for available categories see the Azure Active Directory Marketplace):
trans-unit.target: Choose up to three categories for your application to be listed under (for available categories see the Azure Active Directory Marketplace):

trans-unit.source: Attach Application Small Icon (PNG file, 45px by 45px, solid background color):
trans-unit.target: Attach Application Small Icon (PNG file, 45px by 45px, solid background color):

trans-unit.source: Attach Application Large Icon (PNG file, 215px by 215px, solid background color):
trans-unit.target: Attach Application Large Icon (PNG file, 215px by 215px, solid background color):

trans-unit.source: Attach Application Logo (PNG file, 150px by 122px, transparent background color):
trans-unit.target: Attach Application Logo (PNG file, 150px by 122px, transparent background color):

trans-unit.source: SAML Integration
trans-unit.target: SAML Integration

trans-unit.source: Any app that supports SAML 2.0 can be integrated directly with an Azure AD tenant using [these instructions to add a custom application](active-directory-saas-custom-apps.md).
trans-unit.target: Any app that supports SAML 2.0 can be integrated directly with an Azure AD tenant using [these instructions to add a custom application](active-directory-saas-custom-apps.md).

trans-unit.source: Once you have tested that your application integration works with Azure AD, send the following information to <waadpartners@microsoft.com>.
trans-unit.target: Once you have tested that your application integration works with Azure AD, send the following information to <waadpartners@microsoft.com>.

trans-unit.source: Provide credentials for a test tenant or account with your application that can be used by the Azure AD team to test the integration.
trans-unit.target: Provide credentials for a test tenant or account with your application that can be used by the Azure AD team to test the integration.

trans-unit.source: Provide the SAML Sign-On URL, Issuer URL (entity ID), and Reply URL (assertion consumer service) values for your application, as described [here](active-directory-saas-custom-apps.md).
trans-unit.target: Provide the SAML Sign-On URL, Issuer URL (entity ID), and Reply URL (assertion consumer service) values for your application, as described [here](active-directory-saas-custom-apps.md).

trans-unit.source: If you typically provide these values as part of a SAML metadata file, then please send that as well.
trans-unit.target: If you typically provide these values as part of a SAML metadata file, then please send that as well.

trans-unit.source: Provide a brief description of how to configure Azure AD as an identity provider in your application using SAML 2.0.
trans-unit.target: Provide a brief description of how to configure Azure AD as an identity provider in your application using SAML 2.0.

trans-unit.source: If your application supports configuring Azure AD as an identity provider through a self-service administrative portal, then please ensure the credentials provided above include the ability to set this up.
trans-unit.target: If your application supports configuring Azure AD as an identity provider through a self-service administrative portal, then please ensure the credentials provided above include the ability to set this up.

trans-unit.source: Provide the info below:
trans-unit.target: Provide the info below:

trans-unit.source: Company Name:
trans-unit.target: Company Name:

trans-unit.source: Company Website:
trans-unit.target: Company Website:

trans-unit.source: Application Name:
trans-unit.target: Application Name:

trans-unit.source: Application Description (256 character limit):
trans-unit.target: Application Description (256 character limit):

trans-unit.source: Application Website (informational):
trans-unit.target: Application Website (informational):

trans-unit.source: Application Technical Support Website or Contact Info:
trans-unit.target: Application Technical Support Website or Contact Info:

trans-unit.source: Application Sign-Up URL where customers go to sign up for and /or purchase the application:
trans-unit.target: Application Sign-Up URL where customers go to sign up for and /or purchase the application:

trans-unit.source: Choose up to three categories for your application to be listed under (for available categories see the [Azure Active Directory Marketplace](https://azure.microsoft.com/marketplace/active-directory/))):
trans-unit.target: Choose up to three categories for your application to be listed under (for available categories see the [Azure Active Directory Marketplace](https://azure.microsoft.com/marketplace/active-directory/))):
